place.name: BRATTLEBY
place.gazetteerText: BRATTLEBY, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; on the Wolds, 4 ½ miles NE of Saxilby r. station, and 7 NNW of Lincoln. Post Town, Hackthorn, under Lincoln. Acres, 1,220. Real property, £1,926. Pop., 153. Houses, 28. The property is all in one estate. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £260. Patron, Balliol College, Oxford. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
